newsitem.title: USA: Williams, PBS to announce joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Williams, PBS to announce joint venture.

text.p: Williams Cos, a natural gas pipeline group with a large telecommunications network, will announce a joint venture with the Public Broadcasting System Thursday to deliver business-education services to desktop computers, industry sources said.

Spokesmen for Williams and PBS declined to comment, but PBS scheduled a news conference for Thursday morning in New York with an unidentified U.S. company listed among the Fortune 500 rankings of major American corporations.

Williams Cos operates an extensive system of fiber optic cables, commonly laid in unused energy pipelines, and will use the cables to deliver a wide array of training and educational programmes to businesses.
Industry sources said the services could save employers substantial sums in travel expenses and labour by making training much more accessible at worksites.
Typical offerings might be a review of new U.S. health regulations or a lecture by a leading business thinker.
The joint venture will also exploit the large library of educational programme held by PBS, one industry source said.
Sun Microsystems, whose chief executive, Scott McNealy, is to appear at the news conference, will supply technology to the enterprise, a source said.
